intro: Cyathula triuncinata var. managuensis, commonly known as the Managua spurge, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, cup-shaped cyathium inflorescence. The plant typically grows in moist, tropical environments and has smooth, waxy leaves. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers surrounded by modified leaves called bracts. The species is often used in ornamental horticulture due to its unique appearance and adaptability to various soil types.
